pageContext.claim: “23% of Federal inmates are illegal immigrants.”
pageContext.analysis: This figure is exaggerated — and misleading — according to available data. About 17 percent of all of the individuals in the custody of the Federal Bureau of Prisons or U.S. Marshals Service were confirmed to be living in the U.S. illegally, as of Dec. 31, 2017, according to data examined by FactCheck.org. Moreover, it's wrong to focus on just the federal prison population when the overwhelming majority of inmates are incarcerated in state prisons and local jails.
